page.title: 13Dargate Motor Museum
page.content: Dargate Historic Transport Collection is a private collection of veteran and vintage cars,lorries and motor bikes housed at Chapel Plantation, Dargate. The vehicles have been collected over the past 28 years and provide a fascinating glimpse of the past. The oldest cars are a 1903 CLEMENT and a 1903 RAMBLER both of which have been on the London to Brighton Run. In the museum building exhibits are arranged against a mural of an oldfashioned street together with many accessories. Outside stand old carts, ploughs and wagons in an orchard setting. There has been some controversy locally over planning permission for the building but this has now been regularised and application made for permission to open the museum to the public.
